wordList.definition: the changing of a liquid into a gas, often under the influence of heat (as in the boiling of water)
the conversion of a vapor or gas to a liquid; water that collects as droplets on a cold surface when humid air is in contact with it
any product of the condensation of atmospheric water vapor that falls under gravity
when water that falls from the clouds as rain, snow, hail or sleet, collects in the oceans, rivers, lakes, streams

6.prompt: Team up with your partner to explain the watercycle in 4-7 sentences.
6.name: Watercycle Overview
6.description: Two students write a passage together using the following words: evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and collection.

wordList.definition: the group of people who control and make decisions for a country, state, etc.
a chemical that is used to kill animals or insects that damage plants or crops
something that is formed by combining two or more things
a science that deals with the relationships between groups of living things and their environments
a fuel (such as coal, oil, or natural gas) that is formed in the earth from dead plants or animals
a unit of heat used to indicate the amount of energy that foods will produce in the human body
a high-level overall plan embracing the general goals and acceptable procedures especially of a governmental body

4.prompt: How do you think we might be taking risks with our health and the health of the human world by being part of the industrial food chain?
4.name: Omnivore's Dilemma
4.description: Two students write a passage together using the following words: government, pesticide, hybrid, ecological, fossil fuel, calorie, and policy.

wordList.definition: done consciously and intentionally
a great victory or achievement
deprived of the power of sensation
a rope or chain with which an animal is tied to restrict its movement
poke (someone) with a finger, foot, or pointed object
make (secret or new information) known
a person who is responsible for a crime or other misdeed
give work to (someone) and pay them for it

1.prompt: You were awakened one morning by a talking parrot. "I know where a treasure is buried," it squawked...
1.name: A Buried Treasure
1.description: Two students write a passage together using the following words: deliberate, triumph, numb, tether, prod, disclose, culprit, and employ.

wordList.definition: necessary or central part of an idea; the basis
cannot be given or taken away from the possessor
a written document that defines an entity's rights and priveleges
to confirm the validity of
the state of being worthy of honor or respect
to support or defend; to not judge against something
to raise to a higher level; to help or assist
to keep from being harmed

3.prompt: We believe in human rights because...
3.name: Human Rights
3.description: Two students write a passage together using the following words: fundamental, inalienable, charter, reaffirm, dignity, uphold, promote, and protect.

wordList.definition: The outer limits or edge of an area
a backpack, often made of strong materials
The time right before night; the darker stage of twilight
Sleep
Nervous; shaking

2.prompt: After eating the last s'more, I decided to go to bed. That is when I first heard...
2.name: The Woods at Night
2.description: Two students write a passage together using the following words: periphery, rucksack, dusk, slumber, and tremulous.

wordList.definition: (v) to produce flowers, to develop or open up
(v) to strike against each other, to clash
(adj) never stopping, recurring

(v) to draw attention to something else

(n) a plan, set of rules, a written contract
(n) a trembling motion (v) to tremble
(adj) small in size, not much
(v) to put things in near or proper order

5.prompt: You wake up in a garden full of elves and fairies. An elf begins to chase you....
5.name: Ms. Wieland's Lesson
5.description: Two students write a passage together using the following words: blossom, collide, constant, content, distract, drought, foul, noble, policy, quiver, slight, tidy.
